Text: Look at you, almost halfway there. We’ve got another VIP coming in today, by the way! You know what they say, ‘hasta like a vista, baby’!
Unacceptable performance today, Theo! We have standards around here, and you’re not meeting them!
Look, it’s great you took care of the VIP and all, but we have quotas to meet!
Good work today. No tips for you, of course. Alright, I’m heading out again.
Am I at least allowed to sleep-? Aaand he’s gone. Ceiling tiles it is.
Mothf-… I’m sorry, we’re closed. How did you get in here?
Huh, kinda looks like Dad’s bank. He thought he was such a good dad when he gave me money to “invest in my future” or whatever.
Just to warn you, I’m no amateur, Mr. Dealer. No matter the game, I’m a shark.
You’re never good enough, and ya never were!
Agh, it talks! But, that voice-! I remember when you said that to me, dad. Is… is that you?
How about you shut up and focus on what’s right in front of ya! Get yer head in the game!
Great, another person who won’t listen to me! Not that you ever did in life, either. So, I guess this is about right actually.
What, think you’re some kinda clown?! You wish! At least clowns get a steady paycheck!
Missed ya, dad.
I always wanted to beat you growing up, you know. I guess I never did, in the end…
It’s only the winners that matter in the end, son. If you’re not first, you’re nothing.
I was so pissed you wouldn’t give me that loan. Then you went and died a week after I told you to go to Hell…
All you do is dig holes, Theo! And when you dig a hole, you drag the rest of us in it too!
Yeah, well… I was born in a pretty deep pit already. Risking it all was my only choice.
What the hell are these cards?! You must be rigging this! Come out here Satan, let's cut the shit!
Have you ever tried blaming yourself for a change? You’re not God, kid. Not even close.
And you! Just… Ugh. Unless you want to explode into little ghostly bits, check or fold!
You lost Theo! YOU LOST! Hah! Once a loser, always a loser, son.
What the hell is the point of this? Why make me play a rigged game against my father’s ghost?!
YOU ALWAYS LOSE, THEO! EVERYONE AND EVERYTHING YOU EVER TOUCHED, YOU BURNED TO THE GROUND!
Hey, you never said that! Even though you probably thought it! You never supported me!
I’ve tried it all with you, Theo. Any other father would’ve walked out and never looked back long ago.
… Whatever. It’s over, right? I lost. Congratulations, definitely not my Dad. Thanks for teaching me a lesson or whatever.
Great. Time to go, then. Great catching up with you, dad.
Theo… I’m sorry.
Dad..?
I’m sorry…
I’m sorry… It’s my fault you’re a bad person.
If I knew you were so bored with this diner, I would’ve added a bouncy house! Or, maybe a lazy river?
Can’t you just explain things? I think I get what you’re going for here, y’know. With the choices and the doors.
There are a lot of places down here. Stop thinking you’re so smart, and just focus on the customer. Satan, out!
